intro: Allamanda cathartica, commonly known as the yellow allamanda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite and ovate in shape. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and tropical appearance. Allamanda cathartica is typically grown in warm climates and can be propagated through cuttings or seeds.
